publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: A program of an exposition sponsored by the Florida Sentinel and held on June 14th at 8:00 PM.

objectDesc.p: A printed program for the event on 6/14. The back of the single sheet has a handwritten note.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

head.name: The Choir of Laura Street Presbyterian Church

div.p:
Programme
1. Hymn--“Lift Every Voice and Sing”--(Johnson)…Congregation
2. Invocation…Dr. E. J. Gregg, Pastor
3. Foreword…Attorney Geo. G. DeVaughn.
4. Soprano Solo--“We’ve Fought Every Race’s Battle But Our Own”…
Mrs. R. Andrews Austin
5. Observations--“Contributions by The Press Generally”…
Mrs. Audrey L. Jones
6. Duet--“O Sole Mio”--(E. di Capua)--…--Alvin and Gustavo Nairn.
7. Address--“Contributions Made Toward the Progress of American
Negroes Through the Negro Press and Through the Flori
da Sentinel”…Mr. Joe H. James, Jr.
8. Piano Solo--“Murmuring Zephrs--(Jensen Nieman)…
Mrs. J. B. Andrews
9. Dramatic Reading--Murder Scene from Macbeth, Act II, Scene I…
Mr. John A. Simms.
10. Soprano Solo--(Selected)…Mrs. Alice Wise Gorden.
11. Remarks…Dr. E. J. Gregg
12. Offering.
13. Hymn--(closing)--“Day Is Dying In The West”…Congregation.
Benediction.

Note.--The next program will relate the profession of law, and will be
sponsored by the Colored Bar Association of Jacksonville, Sunday evening,
June 28. Attorney S. D. McGill, president of the Association, will deliver
the address.
